Suppose that <math>\mathfrak{A}</math> is an [[Structure & Truth/L-Structure|<math>\mathfrak{L}</math>-structure]] and <math>s</math>  is a [[Structure & Truth/Variable Assignment Function|variable assignment function]] into <math>\mathfrak{A}</math>. The function <math>\bar{s}</math>, called the term assignment function generated by <math>s</math>, is the function with domain consisting of the set of [[Language/Term|<math>\mathfrak{L}</math>-terms]] and domain <math>A</math> defined recursively as follows:

# If <math>t</math> is a variable, <math>\bar{s}(t) = s(t)</math> 
# If <math>t</math> is a constant symbol <math>c</math>, then <math>\bar{s}(t) = c^{\mathfrak{A}}</math>
# If <math>t :\equiv ft_1t_2, \ldots, t_n</math>, then <math>\bar{s}(t) = f^{\mathfrak{A}}\left(\bar{s}(t_1), \bar{s}(t_2), \ldots, \bar{s}(t_n)\right)</math>
[[Category:Definition]]
[[Category:Structure & Truth]]
